There lots of nice little touches, such as the little basket of chocolates in the room that was re-filled daily, baskets of magazines avaialble in the corridor in different languages etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this website, I decided to book this hotel for our stay in Milan. We were so pleased with this hotel. Loved the little courtyard, the welcoming staff who all spoke English, the simple room, and nice bathroom, we enjoyed breakfast the next morning. It was so close to the Last Supper that we didn't worry about missing our reservation. We walked all around historic Mian and felt the hotel was in a safe area with lots of tourists, yet it was quiet at night. We would recommend anyone going to Milan to stay here. I thought the room rate was very reasonable as well.
reviews.title: Perfect for sight seeing in Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Antica Locanda Leonardo is one of my favorite hotels. Not knowing Milan very well, I found it recommended in a guidebook, and thinking it looked nice, decided to take a chance and try it. I was not disappointed on any level; rather, I had an utterly lovely stay. Its diminutive size lends it a cozy charm bigger hotels simply can't equal, and a level of service to match. Everyone at the hotel was simply wonderful, friendly and helpful and happy to go out of their way to improve the quality of my time in Milan. Breakfast, included in the price, was a real treat, one of the highlights of my day--there's nothing like starting the morning off on the right foot, and with excellent (not to mention free) food and amiable service in a delightful breakfast room, I can't think of a better way. My room was, if simple, elegantly furnished and spotlessly clean, with a fantastic marble shower I was always thankful for when returning to my room after a long day in the summer heat of Milan. If the room wasn't dripping in opulence, it more than made for it in being perfectly charming, with a comfortable bed, plenty of space, and abundant peace and quiet. The hotel itself was always miraculously quiet, really a haven in so bustling a city. The common rooms and hallways are all nicely decorated, including a wonderful outdoor courtyard that was beautiful in the summer. All in all, I found it a quaint and charming hotel with a superlative, courteous staff, tranquility and elegance in abundance, and a thoroughly pleasant decor. The next time I am in Milan, I would love to stay at the Antica Locanda Leonardo again.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.text: The location is great--a short walk to train & metro and the Duomo area. If you can't get tickets to see The Last Supper, don't fret. It is in terrible shape. Try to rent the explanation module (2.50 Euro) and take it into the waiting room and listen to it with the reporduction of the picture. Also, don't miss the church itself. It is free and the chapel on the left, mostly redone, are wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were here in early June. We loved this small hotel, and found all of the staff to be accomodating and charming. Our room was on the garden side, and it was most pleasant to sit on our little balcony sipping Campari and soda or champagne! The breakfast every morning was delicious - I still miss the chocolate croissants,which were the best I've ever eaten! On the recommendation of one of the hotel staff, we ate at the restaurant next door on our last night. The food and atmosphere were wonderful - a perfect end to our trip.
reviews.title: Perfect little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We almost cancelled our reservation here because we wanted to be closer to the airport, but we are so thankful we did not. It was one of the lovliest places we stayed on our trip with the #1 hotel staff we had the pleasure to meet. Paulo was very sweet and was so helpful in finding everything for us to do in the town. The nighttime gentlemen was very helpful and funny as well. Our room and bathroom were comfortable and large and had A/C. The breakfast was very yummy in a comfy room. The location was a dream. Close to everything, but far from ordinary. When we come to Milan again, I will definately stay here again!
reviews.title: Searched forever for the best place to stay in Milan...we found the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Excellent value at 99eur, booked just one week before we arrived. We arrived (my sister & I) from the busy Milan train station,greeted by the usual city chaos and high, large bulidings only to enter this lovely little haven right in the city centre.The hotel was only 2mins in a taxi from Milan Nord station (we had come from Lake Como). We arrived early (at 10:40, we said 12:00, though check in time is usually 14:00), yet our room was made available within 15mins. The man who greeted us was hilarious, very charming and funny. He gave us maps, advice etc outside in the quaint garden area without us having to ask ,while we waited for our room to be ready. Our C-Type room overlooked the courtyard, which was a little noisy in the evening. I was going to bed early though, and we also had the window open as we did not notice there was air conditioning, it had been a cool week for Italians weather wise. Breakfast was very simple-and very sweet! It is about two minute walk to the The Last Supper Chapel, and a further 10/15min walk only to the Duomo & shopping centres.Shops/cafes line this whole walk though so it feels like a stroll. I recommend this hotel and I would even go back to it if had to go to Milan again- even though I like to try new places it felt like such a find!
reviews.title: Excellent location, charming decor & even more charming staff!
